Article Title: WWW inventor says AI may become more powerful than its creator
Article Text:
‘Must be universal’, P 5

'Biggest AI Summit': Ashwini Vaishnaw Says India AI Impact Summit Getting 'Phenomenal Response'

Artificial intelligence has an exciting role to play in fields like drug discovery, scientific progress and disease treatment. But given the pace at which it is evolving, there is a real prospect of AI becoming more powerful than its creator, warns Tim Berners-Lee, British computer scientist and inventor of the World Wide Web.Humanity will have to figure out to how deal with super intelligence, says Berners-Lee, striking a note of caution at a time when companies and govts seem to be in a race to develop AI without really thinking through the consequences.Speaking to Jaya Bhattacharji Rose, Berners-Lee described ChatGPT as a "phase change", which surprised him with its conversational power. He emphasised that the critical question is who an AI works for.He argued for assistants that serve the user's best interests - analogous to a doctor's duty - rather than corporate incentives. He connected this to his Solid project and his company's work on user-controlled data "pods", aiming to restore agency by letting individuals control and selectively share their personal data, including in child-safe configurations with parental oversight.Berners-Lee also contrasted the early web's democratic spirit with today's platform-dominated experience. In the beginning, individuals could publish their own websites and participate on equal footing with major institutions.
Article Summary: Tim berners-lee, inventor of the world wide web, spoke to jaya bhattacharji rose. He argued for assistants that serve the user's best interests - analogous to a doctor's duty - rather than corporate incentives. He also contrasted the early web's democratic spirit with today's platform-dominated experience.

Article Title: Niti Aayog seeks diesel vehicle phase-out, focus on cleaner tech
Article Text:
Former NITI Aayog CEO Hails Budget 2026 Amid Global Economic Uncertainty

NEW DELHI: Niti Aayog has proposed a roadmap for a net zero pathway for the transport sector which includes phasing out diesel vehicles and focusing on cleaner technologies, as well as tightening Corporate Average Fuel Efficiency (CAFE) norms.“The transition strategy should begin with the phased elimination of polluting diesel vehicles and the adoption of lower-emission technologies such as CNG, hybrids, and electric vehicles ,” said the report, while laying down a long-term pathway to achieve net zero transport emissions by 2070.The report, released Tuesday, said the transition would begin with gradual removal of diesel vehicles and a shift towards cleaner technologies such as CNG, hybrids and electric vehicles. In the next phase, the focus will be on greater use of biofuels through flex-fuel vehicles (FFVs), higher Bio-CNG blending and hybrid FFV models, while electric vehicle adoption continues to rise. The final phase is a full shift to zero-emission vehicles.Niti Aayog said road transport depended heavily on fossil fuels, with petrol and diesel accounting for more than 80% of energy consumption. The think tank warned that India’s ability to cut emissions will also depend on how effectively it enforced CAFE norms.
Article Summary: Niti aayog has proposed a roadmap for a net zero pathway for the transport sector. The plan includes phasing out diesel vehicles and focusing on cleaner technologies. The think tank warned that india’s ability to cut emissions will depend on how effectively it enforced cafe norms.

Article Text:
Cleveland Guardians' José Ramírez (Image via AP Photo)

Age, experience, and roster balance

Current status

As of February 2026,has not signed with the Cleveland Guardians. There is no trade and no agreement in place. He is still a free agent. The connection between McCutchen and Cleveland comes from projections and offseason speculation, not from any official announcement.The idea has gained attention because it makes practical sense. Cleveland needs experienced hitting, and McCutchen has said he wants to keep playing. If both sides agree on a short contract and a defined role, a deal would be straightforward.Andrew McCutchen’s one-year, $5 million contract with the Pittsburgh Pirates ended after the 2025 season. Because of that, he can sign with any team without compensation.If Cleveland Guardians moves forward, the contract would likely be for one year in the $2–4 million range, possibly with incentives tied to plate appearances or health. He would project as the designated hitter and could make occasional starts in left or right field.Cleveland’s projected roster remains young.• Outfield: Steven Kwan, Nolan Jones, George Valera, with David Fry as depth.• First base/DH: Kyle Manzardo and C.J. Kayfus, with Kayfus expected to see DH at-bats.Signing McCutchen would likely push Kayfus into more of a platoon role and give manager Stephen Vogt a right-handed hitter to balance a lineup that leans left-handed.Andrew McCutchen hit .239/.333/.367 with 13 home runs and 57 RBIs in 2025. That production is modest but steady for a player entering his age-39 season. He has historically handled right-handed pitching well, which would complement Cleveland’s lineup.He would also add experience to a group built around Bo Naylor, Steven Kwan, Nolan Jones, George Valera, and C.J. Kayfus. The financial risk would be limited because the deal would almost certainly be short-term.McCutchen has said he wants to play in 2026 and has expressed frustration about limited communication from Pittsburgh Pirates’ front office. With Marcell Ozuna expected to fill the DH role there, opportunities appear limited.Cleveland could offer the same type of usage McCutchen has had in recent seasons - mostly DH with limited time in the field.Letting McCutchen walk would create roster space and payroll flexibility while keeping the focus on younger players. Team leadership has also indicated the organization is open to working with him again in some capacity after his playing career.• Adds a right-handed bat for DH and occasional outfield work• Brings experience to a young clubhouse• Requires only a short financial commitment• Age and injury risk, including recent Achilles issues• Could reduce opportunities for younger hitters• Power production is no longer at peak levels• Opportunity to extend his career• Chance to join a competitive rosterCons for McCutchen• Likely a reduced role• Performance decline could affect how his late career is viewedMcCutchen’s numbers are similar to Cleveland’s current DH options but provide more right-handed power.These splits help explain why he could fit as a platoon option against right-handed starters.Andrew McCutchen turns 39 in October 2026 and has played 17 MLB seasons, including 12 with Pittsburgh. He is a five-time All-Star and the 2013 National League MVP.Cleveland Guardians’ projected lineup is younger: Bo Naylor (25), George Valera (25), Kyle Manzardo (25), C.J. Kayfus (24), Nolan Jones (27), and Steven Kwan (28). Aside from Jose Ramirez (33) and reliever Shawn Armstrong (35), the roster has few older players. McCutchen would add experience without needing to play every day.Also read: MLB trade rumors: San Diego Padres consider 15 million San Francisco Giants star to address rotation depth before 2026 season McCutchen remains unsigned. Nothing has been finalized between him and Cleveland. The possibility is reasonable but unresolved, and any deal would depend on Cleveland’s willingness to spend modestly and McCutchen’s interest in leaving Pittsburgh for a new situation.
Article Summary: Andrew mccutchen’s one-year, $5 million contract with the pittsburgh pirates ended after the 2025 season. He is still a free agent and can sign with any team without compensation. If both sides agree on a short contract and a defined role, a deal would be straightforward.

Article Title: Apple iPhone 17e reportedly coming soon: A19 chip, MagSafe charging and other features expected
Article Text:
Apple iPhone 17e features (expected)

Apple iPhone 17e price (expected)

Apple is reportedly gearing up to announce the successor to last year’s iPhone 16e. Likely to be called iPhone 17e, the smartphone “is due imminently”, claims Bloomberg’s Mark Gurman in the latest edition of his weekly PowerOn newsletter. “Apple will market the 17e heavily to users in emerging economies and enterprises — two areas the company plans to target aggressively this year with both devices and software,” Gurman writes in the newsletter. He also shared that the phone will come with a few “big changes” that include iPhone 17’s A19 chipset and MagSafe charging, among others.The upcoming iPhone 17e, Gurman says will be powered by the A19 chip that comes with iPhone 17. The A19 offers a modest boost in CPU speed compared to the A18, but most of its improvement is in GPU, thus allowing it to be even better for AI features and gaming.Further, the handset is tipped to get MagSafe charging feature. Another change coming the iPhone 17e is that it may be equipped with Apple’s newest in-house cellular and wireless chips.Korean news outlet The Elec previously reported that the iPhone 17e is expected to feature slimmer display bezels while retaining the iPhone 14-era OLED panel. Other major new features include an 18MP front camera with Center Stage. This camera automatically extends to show everybody in a group selfie, even when you hold the phone vertically.As far as the pricing of the upcoming iPhone 17e is concerned, Gurman says that the company is planning to keep pricing the same as iPhone 16e. To recall, iPhone 16e launched in 2025 with a price tag of $599 or Rs 59,900 in India.
Article Summary: Apple is reportedly gearing up to announce the successor to last year’s iphone 16e. Likely to be called iphone 17e, the smartphone ‘is due imminently’ the phone will come with a few ‘big changes’ that include iphone 17”s a19 chipset and magsafe charging, among others.

Article Title: India AI summit dates, location: Google CEO Sundar Pichai, OpenAI’s Sam Altman, Meta's Alexandr Wang, Jensen Huang and other tech leaders among key attendees; French President Emmanuel Macron also com
Article Text:
India AI summit dates, location and all things to know

'Biggest AI Summit': Ashwini Vaishnaw Says India AI Impact Summit Getting 'Phenomenal Response'

Who all are attending India AI summit

Indian industrial titans include:

5-star hotels in Delhi fully booked, prices reach Rs 25 lakh for one night

India will soon be the epicenter of the global artificial intelligence (AI) landscape as it is hoting the “India AI Impact Summit 2026” – one of the biggest AI summits in the global south. The event will host a huge gathering of some of the world’s most influential tech leaders. The key attendees include Google CEO Sundar Pichai , Nvidia chief executive Jensen Huang and Meta’s Chief AI Officer Alexandr Wang.The India AI summit is scheduled for February 16–20 in the National Capital, and the event will take place in Bharat Mandapam. On every single day, there will be keynotes, panel discussions and roundtables at Bharat Mandapam/ Sushma Swaraj Bhawan/ Ambedkar Bhawan.The five-day programme will cover policy, research, industry and public engagement, and It will be anchored on 3 foundational pillars, or ‘Sutras’: People, Planet and Progress. The India AI Impact Expo is expected to feature over 300 exhibitors, from 30 countries, across more than 10 thematic pavilions.At this year’s World Economic Forum in Davos, IT minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said that nearly $100 billion in new investments are coming during the upcoming India AI Impact Summit.“Already $70 billion investment is happening and we expect that another $50-$80 billion investment will be coming during the AI Summit. I wouldn't be surprised if we get another $100 billion of investment,” he said. These investments will span across artificial intelligence, semiconductors, infrastructure, and energy, he said.The summit will witness a rare convergence of global “Big Tech” leaders and Indian industrial titans. These include:Sundar Pichai (Google) & Demis Hassabis (Google DeepMind)Jensen Huang (Nvidia)Dario Amodei (Anthropic)Alexandr Wang (Meta)Cristiano Amon (Qualcomm)Nikesh Arora (Palo Alto Networks)Shantannu Narayan (Adobe)Sam Altman (OpenAI) and others.Mukesh Ambani (Reliance Industries)Sunil Bharti Mittal (Bharti Enterprises)K. Krithivasan (TCS)Nandan Nilekani (Infosys)N. Chandrasekaran (Tata Group)According to a report by news agency PTI, five-star hotels in Delhi, including The Taj Palace and The Oberoi, are cashing in on peak demand by offering their luxury suites at a staggering Rs 25 lakh plus taxes for the check-in on February 18 with next day check-out. Standard twin-bed rooms at five-star hotels are also being offered at a steep price for the February 18 check-in, around the peak dates of the India AI Impact Summit 2026 on February 19-20.The Taj Palace is charging a standard rate of Rs 90,000 per night excluding taxes for a luxury suite with king bed pool view, whereas The Oberoi is offering a luxury suite for Rs 3,25,000 per night excluding taxes and fees. For February 18, Taj Palace is offering the Garden Luxury Suite with Private Terrace at Rs 25,00,000 per night.The Luxury Suite at The Leela Palace in New Delhi was available for Rs 17,29,490 per night, excluding taxes and fees, for February 18 check-in, whereas for February 11 check-in, the luxury suite with a balcony is being offered at a much lower rate of Rs 2,94,490 per night, excluding taxes and fees, searches on its website showed.For the February 19 check-in, ITC Maurya's Towers Suite is being offered at a flexible rate of Rs 1,15,000 per night, whereas for the February 11 check-in, it is being offered at Rs 37,000 per night.French President Emmanuel Macron will also be visiting India from February 17 to 19 to attend the AI Impact Summit and launch the India-France Year of Innovation 2026.
Article Summary: The india ai summit is scheduled for february 16–20 in the national capital, and the event will take place in bharat mandapam. The key attendees include google ceo sundar pichai, nvidia chief executive jensen huang and meta’s chief ai officer alexandr wang. Five-star hotels in delhi, including the taj palace and the oberoi, are cashing in on peak demand.

Article Title: India’s most affordable 7-seater gets Rs 60,000 discount: Full details
Article Text:
Renault Triber

BMW Concept Speedtop Walkaround: Only 70 production cars! | TOI Auto

Renault Kwid

Renault Kiger

Do note that the discount details mentioned above have been gathered from a local Renault dealership and may vary depending on location, dealer stock availability and individual eligibility. Buyers are advised to confirm the final offers with their nearest authorised Renault dealer before making a purchase decision.

Renault has rolled out new offers across its budget-focused range this month, aiming to make its models more affordable for buyers. The Triber, positioned as India’s most affordable seven-seat MPV, leads the scheme with benefits of up to Rs 60,000. The company has also announced fresh discounts on the entry-level Kwid and the compact SUV Kiger, catering to a broad set of customers, from first-time buyers to those considering an upgrade. The revised offers are intended to improve accessibility and boost demand across key segments.India’s most affordable 7-seater, the Triber MPV, receives attractive offers, with benefits of up to Rs 60,000 on the Techno and Emotion variants. These include a Rs 10,000 cash discount, a Rs 15,000 exchange bonus and a Rs 10,000 Renault-to-Renault exchange bonus, while loyalty benefits of up to Rs 25,000 are available as per eligibility. The Renault Triber is offered in four trims namely, Authentic, Evolution, Techno, and Emotion. It’s powered by a 1.0-litre, 3-cylinder NA petrol engine that puts out 72hp of power and 96 Nm of torque. It’s offered with either a 5-speed manual or an AMT gearbox, and there’s also CNG retrofitment offered on the facelifted Triber MT variants, along with a 3-year warranty.Features include an 8-inch touchscreen infotainment system, wireless Android Auto and Apple CarPlay, LED cabin lighting, a digital instrument cluster, a cooled lower glove box, push button start, LED DRLs, projector headlights, fog lamps, cruise control and more. Safety features include six airbags, a tyre pressure monitoring system, an electronic stability program, a traction control system, hill-start assist, ABS and EBD with brake assist, ISOFIX child seat anchors, and front and rear parking sensors.The Kwid is available with total benefits of up to Rs 35,000 on the Techno and Climber variants, comprising a cash discount of Rs 20,000, an exchange bonus of Rs 15,000 and an additional Renault-to-Renault exchange bonus of Rs 10,000. A loyalty bonus of up to Rs 25,000 is also applicable, subject to conditions. The Kwid is powered by a 1.0-litre, 3-cylinder petrol engine, which produces 68hp and 91Nm of peak torque. Gearbox options include a 5-speed manual or an AMT. Features include an 8.0-inch touchscreen infotainment system, Apple CarPlay/Android Auto, digital cluster, steering-mounted controls, TPMS, rear view camera, six airbags and more.Discounts on the Kiger vary by variant. The Techno CVT variant gets exchange and additional exchange benefits totalling Rs 25,000, comprising a Rs 15,000 exchange bonus and a Rs 10,000 Renault-to-Renault exchange bonus. Meanwhile, the Techno MT, AMT and Emotion variants receive benefits of up to Rs 35,000, including a Rs 10,000 cash discount, a Rs 15,000 exchange bonus and a Rs 10,000 Renault-to-Renault exchange bonus. Loyalty benefits of up to Rs 25,000 are also available across eligible Kiger variants. The Kiger gets two engine options - a 1.0-litre naturally aspirated petrol engine that puts out 72 PS of power and 96 Nm of Torque paired with either a 5-speed manual or a 5-speed AMT. Another engine is a 1.0-litre, turbo-petrol engine with 100 PS and 160 nm. Gearbox options include a 5-speed manual or a CVT automatic.
Article Summary: Renault has rolled out new offers across its budget-focused range this month. The triber mpv leads the scheme with benefits of up to rs 60,000. The company has also announced fresh discounts on the entry-level kwid and the compact suv kiger.
